013package org.apache.juneau.html;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.collections.JsonMap.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ThrowableUtils.*;
018import java.lang.annotation.*;
019import java.lang.reflect.*;
020import java.nio.charset.*;
021import java.util.*;
022import java.util.function.*;
023import java.util.regex.*;
024
025import org.apache.juneau.*;
026import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
027import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
028import org.apache.juneau.svl.*;
029import org.apache.juneau.utils.*;
030import org.apache.juneau.xml.*;

032/**
033 * Serializes POJOs to HTTP responses as HTML documents.
034 *
035 * <h5 class='topic'>Media types</h5>
036 * <p>
037 * Handles <c>Accept</c> types:  <bc>text/html</bc>
038 * <p>
039 * Produces <c>Content-Type</c> types:  <bc>text/html</bc>
040 *
041 * <h5 class='topic'>Description</h5>
042 * <p>
043 * Same as {@link HtmlSerializer}, except wraps the response in <code><xt>&lt;html&gt;</code>,
044 * <code><xt>&lt;head&gt;</code>, and <code><xt>&lt;body&gt;</code> tags so that it can be rendered in a browser.
045 *
046 * <p>
047 * Configurable properties are typically specified via <ja>@HtmlDocConfig</ja>.
048 *
049 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
050 * <p class='bjava'>
051 *    <ja>@Rest</ja>(
052 *       messages=<js>"nls/AddressBookResource"</js>,
053 *       title=<js>"$L{title}"</js>,
054 *       description=<js>"$L{description}"</js>
055 *    )
056 *    <ja>@HtmlDocConfig</ja>(
057 *       navlinks={
058 *          <js>"api: servlet:/api"</js>,
059 *          <js>"doc: doc"</js>
060 *       }
061 *    )
062 *    <jk>public class</jk> AddressBookResource <jk>extends</jk> BasicRestServlet {
063 * </p>
064 *
065 * <p>
066 * The <c>$L{...}</c> variable represent localized strings pulled from the resource bundle identified by the
067 * <c>messages</c> annotation.
068 * <br>These variables are replaced at runtime based on the HTTP request locale.
069 * <br>Several built-in runtime variable types are defined, and the API can be extended to include user-defined variables.
070 *
071 * <ul class='notes'>
072 *    <li class='note'>This class is thread safe and reusable.
073 * </ul>
074 *
075 * <ul class='seealso'>
076 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-marshall.jm.HtmlDetails">HTML Details</a>
077
078 * </ul>
079 */
080public class HtmlDocSerializer extends HtmlStrippedDocSerializer {
081
082   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
083   // Static
084   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
085
086   private static final String[] EMPTY_ARRAY = new String[0];
087
088   /** Default serializer, all default settings. */
089   public static final HtmlDocSerializer DEFAULT = new HtmlDocSerializer(create());
090
091   /**
092    * Creates a new builder for this object.
093    *
094    * @return A new builder.
095    */
096   public static Builder create() {
097      return new Builder();
098   }
099
100   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
101   // Builder
102   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
103
104   /**
105    * Builder class.
106    */
107   @FluentSetters
108   public static class Builder extends HtmlStrippedDocSerializer.Builder {
109
110      private static final Cache<HashKey,HtmlDocSerializer> CACHE = Cache.of(HashKey.class, HtmlDocSerializer.class).build();
111
112      List<String> aside, footer, head, header, nav, navlinks, script, style, stylesheet;
113      AsideFloat asideFloat;
114      String noResultsMessage;
115      boolean nowrap;
116      Class<? extends HtmlDocTemplate> template;
117      List<Class<? extends HtmlWidget>> widgets;
118
119      /**
120       * Constructor, default settings.
121       */
122      protected Builder() {
123         super();
124         produces("text/html");
125         accept("text/html");
126         asideFloat = AsideFloat.RIGHT;
127         noResultsMessage = "<p>no results</p>";
128         template = BasicHtmlDocTemplate.class;
129      }
130
131      /**
132       * Copy constructor.
133       *
134       * @param copyFrom The bean to copy from.
135       */
136      protected Builder(HtmlDocSerializer copyFrom) {
137         super(copyFrom);
138         aside = copy(copyFrom.aside);
139         footer = copy(copyFrom.footer);
140         head = copy(copyFrom.head);
141         header = copy(copyFrom.header);
142         nav = copy(copyFrom.nav);
143         navlinks = copy(copyFrom.navlinks);
144         script = copy(copyFrom.script);
145         style = copy(copyFrom.style);
146         stylesheet = copy(copyFrom.stylesheet);
147         asideFloat = copyFrom.asideFloat;
148         noResultsMessage = copyFrom.noResultsMessage;
149         nowrap = copyFrom.nowrap;
150         template = copyFrom.template;
151         widgets = copy(copyFrom.widgets);
152      }
153
154      /**
155       * Copy constructor.
156       *
157       * @param copyFrom The builder to copy from.
158       */
159      protected Builder(Builder copyFrom) {
160         super(copyFrom);
161         aside = copy(copyFrom.aside);
162         footer = copy(copyFrom.footer);
163         head = copy(copyFrom.head);
164         header = copy(copyFrom.header);
165         nav = copy(copyFrom.nav);
166         navlinks = copy(copyFrom.navlinks);
167         script = copy(copyFrom.script);
168         style = copy(copyFrom.style);
169         stylesheet = copy(copyFrom.stylesheet);
170         asideFloat = copyFrom.asideFloat;
171         noResultsMessage = copyFrom.noResultsMessage;
172         nowrap = copyFrom.nowrap;
173         template = copyFrom.template;
174         widgets = copy(copyFrom.widgets);
175      }
176
177      @Override /* Context.Builder */
178      public Builder copy() {
179         return new Builder(this);
180      }
181
182      @Override /* Context.Builder */
183      public HtmlDocSerializer build() {
184         return cache(CACHE).build(HtmlDocSerializer.class);
185      }
186
187      @Override /* Context.Builder */
188      public HashKey hashKey() {
189         return HashKey.of(
190            super.hashKey(),
191            aside,
192            footer,
193            head,
194            header,
195            nav,
196            navlinks,
197            script,
198            style,
199            stylesheet,
200            asideFloat,
201            noResultsMessage,
202            nowrap,
203            template,
204            widgets
205         );
206      }
207
208      //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
209      // Properties
210      //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
211
212      /**
213       * Aside section contents.
214       *
215       * <p>
216       * Allows you to specify the contents of the aside section on the HTML page.
217       * The aside section floats on the right of the page for providing content supporting the serialized content of
218       * the page.
219       *
220       * <p>
221       * By default, the aside section is empty.
222       *
223       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
224       * <p class='bjava'>
225       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
226       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
227       *       .aside(
228       *          <js>"&lt;ul&gt;"</js>,
229       *          <js>" &lt;li&gt;Item 1"</js>,
230       *          <js>" &lt;li&gt;Item 2"</js>,
231       *          <js>" &lt;li&gt;Item 3"</js>,
232       *          <js>"&lt;/ul&gt;"</js>
233       *       )
234       *       .build();
235       * </p>
236       *
237       * <ul class='notes'>
238       *    <li class='note'>
239       *       Format: HTML
240       *    <li class='note'>
241       *       Supports <a class="doclink" href="../../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-rest-server.jrs.SvlVariables">SVL Variables</a>
242       *       (e.g. <js>"$L{my.localized.variable}"</js>).
243       *    <li class='note'>
244       *       A value of <js>"NONE"</js> can be used to force no value.
245       *    <li class='note'>
246       *       The parent value can be included by adding the literal <js>"INHERIT"</js> as a value.
247       *    <li class='note'>
248       *       Multiple values are combined with newlines into a single string.
249       *    <li class='note'>
250       *       On methods, this value is inherited from the <ja>@HtmlDocConfig</ja> annotation on the servlet/resource class.
251       *    <li class='note'>
252       *       On servlet/resource classes, this value is inherited from the <ja>@HtmlDocConfig</ja> annotation on the
253       *       parent class.
254       * </ul>
255       *
256       * @param value
257       *    The new value for this property.
258       * @return This object.
259       */
260      @FluentSetter
261      public Builder aside(String...value) {
262         aside = merge(aside, value);
263         return this;
264      }
265
266      /**
267       * Returns the list of aside section contents.
268       *
269       * <p>
270       * Gives access to the inner list if you need to make more than simple additions via {@link #aside(String...)}.
271       *
272       * @return The list of aside section contents.
273       * @see #aside(String...)
274       */
275      public List<String> aside() {
276         if (aside == null)
277            aside = list();
278         return aside;
279      }
280
281      /**
282       * Float aside section contents.
283       *
284       * <p>
285       * Allows you to position the aside contents of the page around the main contents.
286       *
287       * <p>
288       * By default, the aside section is floated to the right.
289       *
290       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
291       * <p class='bjava'>
292       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
293       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
294       *       .aside(
295       *          <js>"&lt;ul&gt;"</js>,
296       *          <js>" &lt;li&gt;Item 1"</js>,
297       *          <js>" &lt;li&gt;Item 2"</js>,
298       *          <js>" &lt;li&gt;Item 3"</js>,
299       *          <js>"&lt;/ul&gt;"</js>
300       *       )
301       *       .asideFloat(<jsf>RIGHT</jsf>)
302       *       .build();
303       * </p>
304       *
305       * @param value
306       *    The new value for this property.
307       * @return This object.
308       */
309      @FluentSetter
310      public Builder asideFloat(AsideFloat value) {
311         asideFloat = value;
312         return this;
313      }
314
315      /**
316       * Footer section contents.
317       *
318       * <p>
319       * Allows you to specify the contents of the footer section on the HTML page.
320       *
321       * <p>
322       * By default, the footer section is empty.
323       *
324       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
325       * <p class='bjava'>
326       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
327       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
328       *       .footer(
329       *          <js>"&lt;b&gt;This interface is great!&lt;/b&gt;"</js>
330       *       )
331       *       .build();
332       * </p>
333       *
334       * @param value
335       *    The new value for this property.
336       * @return This object.
337       */
338      @FluentSetter
339      public Builder footer(String...value) {
340         footer = merge(footer, value);
341         return this;
342      }
343
344      /**
345       * Returns the list of footer section contents.
346       *
347       * <p>
348       * Gives access to the inner list if you need to make more than simple additions via {@link #footer(String...)}.
349       *
350       * @return The list of footer section contents.
351       * @see #footer(String...)
352       */
353      public List<String> footer() {
354         if (footer == null)
355            footer = list();
356         return footer;
357      }
358
359      /**
360       * Additional head section content.
361       *
362       * <p>
363       * Adds the specified HTML content to the head section of the page.
364       *
365       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
366       * <p class='bjava'>
367       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
368       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
369       *       .head(
370       *          <js>"&lt;link rel='icon' href='$U{servlet:/htdocs/mypageicon.ico}'&gt;"</js>
371       *       )
372       *       .build();
373       * </p>
374       *
375       * @param value
376       *    The new value for this property.
377       * @return This object.
378       */
379      @FluentSetter
380      public Builder head(String...value) {
381         head = merge(head, value);
382         return this;
383      }
384
385      /**
386       * Returns the list of head section contents.
387       *
388       * <p>
389       * Gives access to the inner list if you need to make more than simple additions via {@link #head(String...)}.
390       *
391       * @return The list of head section contents.
392       * @see #head(String...)
393       */
394      public List<String> head() {
395         if (head == null)
396            head = list();
397         return head;
398      }
399
400      /**
401       * Header section contents.
402       *
403       * <p>
404       * Allows you to override the contents of the header section on the HTML page.
405       * The header section normally contains the title and description at the top of the page.
406       *
407       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
408       * <p class='bjava'>
409       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
410       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
411       *       .header(
412       *          <js>"&lt;h1&gt;My own header&lt;/h1&gt;"</js>
413       *       )
414       *       .build()
415       * </p>
416       *
417       * @param value
418       *    The new value for this property.
419       * @return This object.
420       */
421      @FluentSetter
422      public Builder header(String...value) {
423         header = merge(header, value);
424         return this;
425      }
426
427      /**
428       * Returns the list of header section contents.
429       *
430       * <p>
431       * Gives access to the inner list if you need to make more than simple additions via {@link #header(String...)}.
432       *
433       * @return The list of header section contents.
434       * @see #header(String...)
435       */
436      public List<String> header() {
437         if (header == null)
438            header = list();
439         return header;
440      }
441
442      /**
443       * Nav section contents.
444       *
445       * <p>
446       * Allows you to override the contents of the nav section on the HTML page.
447       * The nav section normally contains the page links at the top of the page.
448       *
449       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
450       * <p class='bjava'>
451       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
452       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
453       *       .nav(
454       *          <js>"&lt;p class='special-navigation'&gt;This is my special navigation content&lt;/p&gt;"</js>
455       *       )
456       *       .build()
457       * </p>
458       *
459       * <p>
460       * When this property is specified, the {@link Builder#navlinks(String...)} property is ignored.
461       *
462       * @param value
463       *    The new value for this property.
464       * @return This object.
465       */
466      @FluentSetter
467      public Builder nav(String...value) {
468         nav = merge(nav, value);
469         return this;
470      }
471
472      /**
473       * Returns the list of nav section contents.
474       *
475       * <p>
476       * Gives access to the inner list if you need to make more than simple additions via {@link #nav(String...)}.
477       *
478       * @return The list of nav section contents.
479       * @see #nav(String...)
480       */
481      public List<String> nav() {
482         if (nav == null)
483            nav = list();
484         return nav;
485      }
486
487      /**
488       * Page navigation links.
489       *
490       * <p>
491       * Adds a list of hyperlinks immediately under the title and description but above the content of the page.
492       *
493       * <p>
494       * This can be used to provide convenient hyperlinks when viewing the REST interface from a browser.
495       *
496       * <p>
497       * The value is an array of strings with two possible values:
498       * <ul>
499       *    <li>A key-value pair representing a hyperlink label and href:
500       *       <br><js>"google: http://google.com"</js>
501       *    <li>Arbitrary HTML.
502       * </ul>
503       *
504       * <p>
505       * Relative URLs are considered relative to the servlet path.
506       * For example, if the servlet path is <js>"http://localhost/myContext/myServlet"</js>, and the
507       * URL is <js>"foo"</js>, the link becomes <js>"http://localhost/myContext/myServlet/foo"</js>.
508       * Absolute (<js>"/myOtherContext/foo"</js>) and fully-qualified (<js>"http://localhost2/foo"</js>) URLs
509       * can also be used in addition to various other protocols specified by {@link UriResolver} such as
510       * <js>"servlet:/..."</js>.
511       *
512       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
513       * <p class='bjava'>
514       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
515       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
516       *       .navlinks(
517       *          <js>"api: servlet:/api"</js>,
518       *          <js>"stats: servlet:/stats"</js>,
519       *          <js>"doc: doc"</js>
520       *       )
521       *       .build();
522       * </p>
523       *
524       * @param value
525       *    The new value for this property.
526       * @return This object.
527       */
528      @FluentSetter
529      public Builder navlinks(String...value) {
530         navlinks = mergeNavLinks(navlinks, value);
531         return this;
532      }
533
534      /**
535       * Returns the list of navlinks section contents.
536       *
537       * <p>
538       * Gives access to the inner list if you need to make more than simple additions via {@link #navlinks(String...)}.
539       *
540       * @return The list of navlinks section contents.
541       * @see #navlinks(String...)
542       */
543      public List<String> navlinks() {
544         if (navlinks == null)
545            navlinks = list();
546         return navlinks;
547      }
548
549      /**
550       * No-results message.
551       *
552       * <p>
553       * Allows you to specify the string message used when trying to serialize an empty array or empty list.
554       *
555       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
556       * <p class='bjava'>
557       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
558       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
559       *       .noResultsMessage(<js>"&lt;b&gt;This interface is great!&lt;/b&gt;"</js>)
560       *       .build();
561       * </p>
562       *
563       * <p>
564       * A value of <js>"NONE"</js> can be used to represent no value to differentiate it from an empty string.
565       *
566       * @param value
567       *    The new value for this property.
568       * @return This object.
569       */
570      @FluentSetter
571      public Builder noResultsMessage(String value) {
572         noResultsMessage = value;
573         return this;
574      }
575
576      /**
577       * Prevent word wrap on page.
578       *
579       * <p>
580       * Adds <js>"* {white-space:nowrap}"</js> to the CSS instructions on the page to prevent word wrapping.
581       *
582       * @return This object.
583       */
584      @FluentSetter
585      public Builder nowrap() {
586         return nowrap(true);
587      }
588
589      /**
590       * Same as {@link #nowrap()} but allows you to explicitly specify the boolean value.
591       *
592       * @param value
593       *    The new value for this property.
594       * @return This object.
595       * @see #nowrap()
596       */
597      @FluentSetter
598      public Builder nowrap(boolean value) {
599         nowrap = value;
600         return this;
601      }
602
603      /**
604       * Adds the specified Javascript code to the HTML page.
605       *
606       * <p>
607       * A shortcut on <ja>@Rest</ja> is also provided for this setting:
608       * <p class='bjava'>
609       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
610       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
611       *       .script(<js>"alert('hello!');"</js>)
612       *       .build();
613       * </p>
614       *
615       * @param value
616       *    The value to add to this property.
617       * @return This object.
618       */
619      @FluentSetter
620      public Builder script(String...value) {
621         script = merge(script, value);
622         return this;
623      }
624
625      /**
626       * Returns the list of page script contents.
627       *
628       * <p>
629       * Gives access to the inner list if you need to make more than simple additions via {@link #script(String...)}.
630       *
631       * @return The list of page script contents.
632       * @see #script(String...)
633       */
634      public List<String> script() {
635         if (script == null)
636            script = list();
637         return script;
638      }
639
640      /**
641       * Adds the specified CSS instructions to the HTML page.
642       *
643       * <p class='bjava'>
644       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
645       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
646       *       .style(
647       *          <js>"h3 { color: red; }"</js>,
648       *          <js>"h5 { font-weight: bold; }"</js>
649       *       )
650       *       .build();
651       * </p>
652       *
653       * @param value
654       *    The value to add to this property.
655       * @return This object.
656       */
657      @FluentSetter
658      public Builder style(String...value) {
659         style = merge(style, value);
660         return this;
661      }
662
663      /**
664       * Returns the list of page style contents.
665       *
666       * <p>
667       * Gives access to the inner list if you need to make more than simple additions via {@link #style(String...)}.
668       *
669       * @return The list of page style contents.
670       * @see #style(String...)
671       */
672      public List<String> style() {
673         if (style == null)
674            style = list();
675         return style;
676      }
677
678      /**
679       * Adds to the list of stylesheet URLs.
680       *
681       * <p>
682       * Note that this stylesheet is controlled by the <code><ja>@Rest</ja>.stylesheet()</code> annotation.
683       *
684       * @param value
685       *    The value to add to this property.
686       * @return This object.
687       */
688      @FluentSetter
689      public Builder stylesheet(String...value) {
690         stylesheet = merge(stylesheet, value);
691         return this;
692      }
693
694      /**
695       * Returns the list of stylesheet URLs.
696       *
697       * <p>
698       * Gives access to the inner list if you need to make more than simple additions via {@link #stylesheet(String...)}.
699       *
700       * @return The list of stylesheet URLs.
701       * @see #stylesheet(String...)
702       */
703      public List<String> stylesheet() {
704         if (stylesheet == null)
705            stylesheet = list();
706         return stylesheet;
707      }
708
709      /**
710       * HTML document template.
711       *
712       * <p>
713       * Specifies the template to use for serializing the page.
714       *
715       * <p>
716       * By default, the {@link BasicHtmlDocTemplate} class is used to construct the contents of the HTML page, but
717       * can be overridden with your own custom implementation class.
718       *
719       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
720       * <p class='bjava'>
721       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
722       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
723       *       .template(MySpecialDocTemplate.<jk>class</jk>)
724       *       .build();
725       * </p>
726       *
727       * @param value
728       *    The new value for this property.
729       * @return This object.
730       */
731      @FluentSetter
732      public Builder template(Class<? extends HtmlDocTemplate> value) {
733         template = value;
734         return this;
735      }
736
737      /**
738       * HTML Widgets.
739       *
740       * <p>
741       * Defines widgets that can be used in conjunction with string variables of the form <js>"$W{name}"</js>to quickly
742       * generate arbitrary replacement text.
743       *
744       * Widgets resolve the following variables:
745       * <ul class='spaced-list'>
746       *    <li><js>"$W{name}"</js> - Contents returned by {@link HtmlWidget#getHtml(VarResolverSession)}.
747       *    <li><js>"$W{name.script}"</js> - Contents returned by {@link HtmlWidget#getScript(VarResolverSession)}.
748       *       <br>The script contents are automatically inserted into the <xt>&lt;head/script&gt;</xt> section
749       *           in the HTML page.
750       *    <li><js>"$W{name.style}"</js> - Contents returned by {@link HtmlWidget#getStyle(VarResolverSession)}.
751       *       <br>The styles contents are automatically inserted into the <xt>&lt;head/style&gt;</xt> section
752       *           in the HTML page.
753       * </ul>
754       *
755       * <p>
756       * The following examples shows how to associate a widget with a REST method and then have it rendered in the links
757       * and aside section of the page:
758       *
759       * <p class='bjava'>
760       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
761       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
762       *       .widgets(
763       *          MyWidget.<jk>class</jk>
764       *       )
765       *       .navlinks(
766       *          <js>"$W{MyWidget}"</js>
767       *       )
768       *       .aside(
769       *          <js>"Check out this widget:  $W{MyWidget}"</js>
770       *       )
771       *       .build();
772       * </p>
773       *
774       * <ul class='notes'>
775       *    <li class='note'>
776       *       Widgets are inherited from super classes, but can be overridden by reusing the widget name.
777       * </ul>
778       *
779       * <ul class='seealso'>
780       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-rest-server.jrs.HtmlDocAnnotation.jrs.HtmlWidgets">Widgets</a>
781       * </ul>
782       *
783       * @param values The values to add to this setting.
784       * @return This object.
785       */
786      @FluentSetter
787      @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
788      public Builder widgets(Class<? extends HtmlWidget>...values) {
789         addAll(widgets(), values);
790         return this;
791      }
792
793      /**
794       * Returns the list of page widgets.
795       *
796       * <p>
797       * Gives access to the inner list if you need to make more than simple additions via {@link #widgets(Class...)}.
798       *
799       * @return The list of page widgets.
800       * @see #widgets(Class...)
801       */
802      public List<Class<? extends HtmlWidget>> widgets() {
803         if (widgets == null)
804            widgets = list();
805         return widgets;
806      }
807

1574      //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1575      // Helpers
1576      //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1577
1578      private static <T> List<T> copy(List<T> s) {
1579         return s == null || s.isEmpty() ? null : copyOf(s);
1580      }
1581
1582      private static <T> List<T> copy(T[] s) {
1583         return s.length == 0 ? null : list(s);
1584      }
1585
1586      private List<String> merge(List<String> old, String[] newValues) {
1587         List<String> x = list(newValues.length);
1588         for (String s : newValues) {
1589            if ("NONE".equals(s)) {
1590               if (old != null)
1591                  old.clear();
1592            } else if ("INHERIT".equals(s)) {
1593               if (old != null)
1594                  x.addAll(old);
1595            } else {
1596               x.add(s);
1597            }
1598         }
1599         return x;
1600      }
1601
1602      private List<String> mergeNavLinks(List<String> old, String[] newValues) {
1603         List<String> x = list(newValues.length);
1604         for (String s : newValues) {
1605            if ("NONE".equals(s)) {
1606               if (old != null)
1607                  old.clear();
1608            } else if ("INHERIT".equals(s)) {
1609               if (old != null)
1610                  x.addAll(old);
1611            } else if (s.indexOf('[') != -1 && INDEXED_LINK_PATTERN.matcher(s).matches()) {
1612               Matcher lm = INDEXED_LINK_PATTERN.matcher(s);
1613               lm.matches();
1614               String key = lm.group(1);
1615               int index = Math.min(x.size(), Integer.parseInt(lm.group(2)));
1616               String remainder = lm.group(3);
1617               x.add(index, key.isEmpty() ? remainder : key + ":" + remainder);
1618            } else {
1619               x.add(s);
1620            }
1621         }
1622         return x;
1623      }
1624
1625      private static final Pattern INDEXED_LINK_PATTERN = Pattern.compile("(?s)(\\S*)\\[(\\d+)\\]\\:(.*)");
1626   }
1627
1628   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1629   // Instance
1630   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1631
1632   final String[] style, stylesheet, script, navlinks, head, header, nav, aside, footer;
1633   final AsideFloat asideFloat;
1634   final String noResultsMessage;
1635   final boolean nowrap;
1636   final Class<? extends HtmlDocTemplate> template;
1637   final List<Class<? extends HtmlWidget>> widgets;
1638
1639   private final HtmlWidgetMap widgetMap;
1640   private final HtmlWidget[] widgetArray;
1641   private final HtmlDocTemplate templateBean;
1642
1643   private volatile HtmlSchemaDocSerializer schemaSerializer;
1644
1645   /**
1646    * Constructor.
1647    *
1648    * @param builder The builder for this object.
1649    */
1650   public HtmlDocSerializer(Builder builder) {
1651      super(builder);
1652      style = builder.style != null ? toArray(builder.style) : EMPTY_ARRAY;
1653      stylesheet = builder.stylesheet != null ? toArray(builder.stylesheet) : EMPTY_ARRAY;
1654      script = builder.script != null ? toArray(builder.script) : EMPTY_ARRAY;
1655      head = builder.head != null ? toArray(builder.head) : EMPTY_ARRAY;
1656      header = builder.header != null ? toArray(builder.header) : EMPTY_ARRAY;
1657      nav = builder.nav != null ? toArray(builder.nav) : EMPTY_ARRAY;
1658      aside = builder.aside != null ? toArray(builder.aside) : EMPTY_ARRAY;
1659      footer = builder.footer != null ? toArray(builder.footer) : EMPTY_ARRAY;
1660      navlinks = builder.navlinks != null ? toArray(builder.navlinks) : EMPTY_ARRAY;
1661      asideFloat = builder.asideFloat;
1662      noResultsMessage = builder.noResultsMessage;
1663      nowrap = builder.nowrap;
1664      template = builder.template;
1665      widgets = builder.widgets == null ? emptyList() : copyOf(builder.widgets);
1666
1667      templateBean = newInstance(template);
1668      widgetMap = new HtmlWidgetMap();
1669      widgets.stream().map(x -> newInstance(x)).forEach(x -> widgetMap.append(x));
1670      widgetArray = array(widgetMap.values(), HtmlWidget.class);
1671   }
1672
1673   @Override /* Context */
1674   public Builder copy() {
1675      return new Builder(this);
1676   }
1677
1678   @Override /* Context */
1679   public HtmlDocSerializerSession.Builder createSession() {
1680      return HtmlDocSerializerSession.create(this);
1681   }
1682
1683   @Override /* Context */
1684   public HtmlDocSerializerSession getSession() {
1685      return createSession().build();
1686   }
1687
1688   @Override /* XmlSerializer */
1689   public HtmlSerializer getSchemaSerializer() {
1690      if (schemaSerializer == null)
1691         schemaSerializer = HtmlSchemaDocSerializer.create().beanContext(getBeanContext()).build();
1692      return schemaSerializer;
1693   }

1795      return nowrap;

1843    * HTML widgets.

1848    */
1849   protected final HtmlWidgetMap getWidgets() {
1850      return widgetMap;
1851   }
1852
1853   /**
1854    * Performs an action on all widgets defined on this serializer.
1855    *
1856    * @param action The action to perform.
1857    * @return This object.
1858    */
1859   protected final HtmlDocSerializer forEachWidget(Consumer<HtmlWidget> action) {
1860      for (HtmlWidget w : widgetArray)
1861         action.accept(w);
1862      return this;
1863   }

1869   private String[] toArray(List<String> x) {
1870      return x.toArray(new String[x.size()]);
1871   }
1872
1873   private <T> T newInstance(Class<T> c) {
1874      try {
1875         return c.newInstance();
1876      } catch (Exception e) {
1877         throw asRuntimeException(e);
1878      }
1879   }

1881   @Override /* Context */
1882   protected JsonMap properties() {
1883      return filteredMap()
1884         .append("header", header)
1885         .append("nav", nav)
1886         .append("navlinks", navlinks)
1887         .append("aside", aside)
1888         .append("asideFloat", asideFloat)
1889         .append("footer", footer)
1890         .append("style", style)
1891         .append("head", head)
1892         .append("stylesheet", stylesheet)
1893         .append("nowrap", nowrap)
1894         .append("template", template)
1895         .append("noResultsMessage", noResultsMessage)
1896         .append("widgets", widgets);
1897   }
